go_data.justification: RIP interacts with Fas(CD95) or TNFR1 via interaction of the death domains.
RIP is recruited to Fas(CD95) or TNFR1 and leads to the recruitment of downstream signal molecules that act to initiate cascades leading to cell death or activation.
RIP interacts with Fas(CD95) or TNFR1, which are receptors on the cell surface, implying RIP is located in the cytoplasm.
RIP is recruited to the TNF receptor-1 signaling complex, which contains protein kinases.
RIP causes cell death when interacting with Fas/APO-1(CD95).
